intro: Liabum meridense, commonly known as the southern liabum, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of the United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Liabum meridense is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
